intro.description: Follow these steps to create a Symbian OS project and debug it using the S60 EPOC Emulator.

item.title: Verify a Symbian SDK is available
item.description: Use the SDK Preferences panel to verify a supported Symbian SDK is installed. If not, you'll need to download a supported SDK and install it before continuing.

item.title: Create a Symbian OS project
item.description: Use the New Project wizard to create a Symbian OS project. We named our example HelloCarbide.

item.title: Build the project
item.description: If you don't see an EXE file in the C/C++ Projects view, build the project to create one.

item.title: Set a breakpoint
item.description: Open the CHelloCarbideAppUI file and set a breakpoint in the HandleCommandL routine.

item.title: Launch the debugger
item.description: The first time Carbide.c++ launches a project it creates a debug launch configuration using preset project settings. It then switches to the Debug perspective, launches the S60 EPOC Emulator, and waits for a breakpoint to be hit. When it does, control is returned to the Carbide debugger.

item.title: Resume the debugger
item.description: Click Resume in the Debug view to pass control back to the emulator.
